data.title: ALB Japan Law Awards 2024
data.text:
JUDGES

Each year, ALB invites an independent judging panel of senior and expert legal industry leaders from various sectors corresponding to the diverse list of award categories. ALB is pleased to list some of the distinguished judges. The rest of the panel will be revealed on the evening of the awards.

Arshad Karim

Director & Head of Legal, Japan, Abbott Japan LLC

Arshad Karim is Director & Head of Legal, Japan at Abbott since June 2023, leading a team of two attorneys and responsible for Abbott's legal function in Japan, and is involved in commercial, anti-trust, regulatory, employment, and privacy laws, among other matters

Before joining Abbott, Arshad Karim served as Director & Associate General Counsel for Twitter, and was responsible for all legal matters in Japan and Korea, including but not limited to drafting and negotiating various commercial agreements, managing litigation, and advising on privacy, law enforcement, and employment matters.

Prior to Twitter, he served as Senior Vice President & Legal Counsel for Nikko Asset Management Co., Ltd where Arshad was involved in projects such as acquisitions of asset management companies in Singapore, Australia, New Zealand, and Malaysia, establishment of joint ventures in China and India, and the listing process with the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

Prior to that, he was Legal Counsel & Chief Privacy Officer for IMS Japan, an American pharmaceutical data firm where he led the Company’s efforts to comply with the Personal Information Protection Law of Japan. His previous positions also include tenure at Hayabusa Kokusai Law Offices and Deloitte & Touche in New York. He received a B.A. with Distinction in Biological Sciences from Cornell University and a J.D. from Loyola Law School.

Andreas Höppel

CLO / General Counsel, Koki Holdings

Andreas is a graduate of Heidelberg University with 1 year of foreign studies at Kyoto University. He passed the bar exam following legal clerkship at Berlin high court, with stages at the German embassy in Japan and multinational law firm in Tokyo. Andreas started working from 2010 at boutique law firms specializing in insolvency and restructuring in Düsseldorf and Munich. He went in-house to a SME in the renewables sector in 2013 and was subsequently sent as GC APAC to its newly established subsidiary in Japan. He moved to SEGA Corporation in 2015 where he became Head of Legal and GC Japan Asia before taking on his latest challenge as CLO and Global GC at Koki Holdings in 2024.

Emi Takeda

Board Member, Accenture Japan

Emi is a senior international lawyer with over 20-year experience at top global law firms and as head of legal for Accenture Japan. In her current role as Managing Director of Legal, and Board Member at Accenture Japan, she manages a team of more than 110 lawyers and contract professionals. Emi received her LL.B. from the University of Tokyo and graduated from the Legal Training and Research Institute of Japan. Emi received her LL.M. from Columbia Law School. Emi is a Japanese bengoshi admitted to practice in Japan and she is also admitted in New York.

John Paul Huntington Vigman

Vice President, Business Development Major Projects (formerly General Counsel – Japan) Veolia Japan K.K.

30+ years transactional experience and negotiations in Project Financings, BOT, BOO, PPA, O&M, EPC, concession, joint ventures and M&A for energy (CHP, cogen, LNG, gas, coal, HFO, Nuclear, solar, wind, biomass), infrastructure, mining, manufacturing, and deluxe hotel projects worldwide: (I) Developer/Sponsors: HFO and gas fueled power plants, LNG regasification terminals, on-shore balance of plant and turbine, hydro plants, undersea transmission, off-shore wind; on-shore wind, gold and iron ore mining, desalination plants, utility sized solar power plants, biomass/sludge plants; (II) Project Lenders: transmission lines, LNG regasification terminals, generation using onshore wind, nuclear power plant, geothermal, utility sized solar, gas fueled power plants; high speed rail; (iii) EPC Contractors: manufacturing, lithium, utility solar powered plants. Recent Japanese project finance and joint venture experience in biomass renewable (from 6MW to 80Mw) in Okinawa, Chiba, Kanagawa, Tochigi, Miyagi, Aomori, Kyushu, Kyushu including wood, sludge, food waste; joint ventures for plastic recycling plants for the automotive and food & beverage branches. Former legal experience as general counsel at Renaissance Hotels for Europe Middle East Africa (EMEA) zone (now Marriott), Hunter Douglas for EMEA zone, Veolia Japan, project finance attorney at Shearman & Sterling and White & Case.

Jerome Hamilton

Head of Legal, Japan and Green Solutions APAC, ENGIE

Jerome Hamilton is the Head of Legal for Japan and Green Solutions APAC at ENGIE, which is one of the largest power utilities in the world. Jerome has worked in London, Paris, Singapore, Bangkok and Tokyo, both in private practice and in-house, in particular with ENGIE, where he has been focusing on M&A and project development within the renewable energy sector. In this capacity, Jerome has supported ENGIE in its innovative green hydrogen projects in Australia, joint venture arrangements in Japan, Singapore and Australia, as well as the divestment of ENGIE’s remaining thermal power assets in the APAC region. In Japan, ENGIE is focused on trading physical power and applying innovative solutions to help the country in its decarbonization efforts, through for instance green power purchase agreements. Jerome is supporting these efforts in Japan and elsewhere in the region, with a particular focus on Southeast Asia.

Kinyoshi Tokuyama

Head of Legal Japan, NetEase Games

Kinyoshi Tokuyama brings over 15 years of experience in global IP strategy, media, and technology transactions. As the Head of Legal Japan for NetEase Games, his primary focus is to facilitate the development and publication of AAA video games from Japan to the global market. Previously, his leadership roles at various multinational corporations and startups ranges from securing global media rights for anime and live-action content production at Netflix to building patent strategy to protect and leverage Mujin’s bleeding edge robotics technology worldwide. Kinyoshi holds a BA from UCLA and a JD from Santa Clara University School of Law, and is admitted to practice law in California and practice before the USPTO. Prior to his legal career, Kinyoshi was an IT consultant and a software engineer.

Hiroshi Miyashita

Professor of Law, Chuo University

Hiroshi Miyashita is Professor of Law at Chuo University in Tokyo. He specializes in constitutional law and information law. Prior to the current position, Miyashita served for the Office of Personal Information Protection in the Cabinet Office of Japan. He received Doctor in Law from Hitotsubashi University. He was a visiting scholar at Harvard Law School, Brussels Privacy Hub, Vrijie Universiteit Brussel and CRIDS (Centre de Recherche Information, Droit et Société), University of Namur. He published five books on privacy including the EU GDPR Commentary in Japanese and over 100 academic articles including many on privacy and data protection.

Hiromitsu Kobayashi

Chief Legal Officer, Adecco Ltd

Hiromitsu is Chief Legal Officer, Adecco Ltd. Adecco is a global HR services company headquartered in Switzerland having contributed to improve employability and access to decent work with nearly 40 year history in Japan. He loves in-house legal roles throughout his over 20 year career at various Japanese/ US/ European enterprises. Prior to Adecco, he was senior legal manager at Unilever Japan and GC at Oisix ra daichi Inc. He is also an external director at SuRaLa Net, tobimushi, and company auditor at eumo.

He has special legal interests in the fields of the environment and natural resources, real estate, dispute resolutions, and most recently future legal profession with AI tech, employment and sustainability. He is admitted to practice law in New York.

Masatoshi Adachi

Senior Executive Officer, Chief Data Protection Officer, General Counsel, JMDC

Graduated from the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Engineering, Department of Systems Innovation, and completed the Legal Training Course at the Graduate School of Law and Politics of the University of Tokyo.

I worked as a legal specialist at Jones Day Law Offices, the Japan Patent Office, and LINE Corporation (currently LINE Yahoo! Japan) before assuming my current position. I am a senior researcher at the Japan Information Legislation Institute (JILIS) and a board member of the Japan Registered Information Security Specialists’ Association (JP-RISSA).

Mizuki Hayashi,

Associate General Counsel, Japan & RoAsia, Legal Division, Canadian Solar Projects K.K.

Mizuki Hayashi is Associate General Counsel for Canadian Solar. As a regional head of legal, he has engaged in acquisition, development, finance, and sale of more than 300MW solar projects in Japan and other Asian countries since 2018. He also serves on Board Member at Canadian Solar Asset Management K.K, an asset management company of TSE listed infrastructure fund.

Prior to joining Canadian Solar, Mizuki was a compliance officer at Morgan Stanley. He also worked for Ministry of Foreign Affairs and was involved in various economic treaties including Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement.

Mizuki is admitted to practice law in Japan and New York. He is also a Certified Public Accountant (WA, USA) and Chartered Financial Analyst.

Mari Hiraizumi

General Counsel, Japan, GlaxoSmithKline K.K.

Mari Hiraizumi, an attorney qualified in Japan and New York, has been an in-house counsel in the pharmaceutical industry since 2007, after her tenures at a law firm and Japan's Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Presently, she is the General Counsel and Board Member at GSK Japan and an external director at a Japanese company. Hiraizumi also contributed to a METI study group on legal strategies for international competitiveness in 2018-2019.

Steven Howard

Senior Legal Counsel, Japan & Pan-Asia, Fiskars Group

Steven Howard is Senior Legal Counsel for the Fiskars Group, a Finnish consumer products company which includes such iconic brands as Wedgwood, Waterford and Royal Copenhagen. He handles all legal matters across the Asia-Pacific region. Prior to joining Fiskars this year Steven was a senior counsel with Sony in Tokyo and Singapore for eight years, including two years as Global Privacy Officer for Sony's mobile business group. Originally from the US, Steven has practiced law in Asia for over 20 years, both in-house and in private practice.

Terufumi Yorita

Chief Legal Officer, ABeam Consulting Ltd.

Terufumi is Chief Legal Officer, ABeam Consulting Ltd. ABeam is a global consulting firm headquartered in Tokyo with more than 8,000 employees worldwide. He has more than 30 years of varied in-house counsel experience at Japanese/Chinese/US MNCs. Prior to ABeam, he was CLO at Shiseido, Asia Pacific General Counsel at Lenovo and several other roles at MNCs.

Throughout his career, Terufumi handled wide variety of matters including M&A, corporate governance, board secretariat, compliance/investigation, risk management and IP license/litigation, and managed country, regional and global legal teams as CLO/GC. He is admitted to practice law in New York.

Toshinori Uneki

Senior Director, Head of Japan Legal & Compliance, Adidas Japan

Toshinori "Toshi" Uneki, an accomplished legal professional based in Tokyo, Japan, has over 25 years of experience. Originally a dedicated practitioner at Nishimura & Asahi, Toshi later transitioned to high-level in-house roles, including at ZOZOTOWN, Japan's leading fashion e-commerce platform. He has expertly navigated major corporations through complex legal terrains and cross-border transactions. A graduate of Keio University Law and Georgetown Law (LL.M.). Toshi also contributes as a lecturer on Art Management at Keio University.

Yoshio Sano

Director & Regional General Counsel, Far East, Chubb Insurance Japan

Yoshio Sano joined Chubb Insurance Japan as Executive Director and General Counsel, Far East in June 2017 and was promoted a director in March 2018. He manages 6 departments, Legal, Compliance, Solicitation Compliance, Solicitation materials Control, Product Filing and Government Affairs.

Before joining Chubb, he belonged to BNP Paribas Cardif Japan as General Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer from 2015. Also, he worked for Tokyo office of Aetos Japan, an American asset management company from 2009 to 2015 and for an investment management subsidiary of Namura Holdings from 2005 to 2008 as General Counsel. He started his business carrier at Nippon Life Insurance in 1985 and experienced in Claims, NLI Research Institute, HR, Legal and Real Estate until 2005. The final job title was General Counsel for Real Estate. He obtained LL.B at University of Tokyo in 1985 and LL.M at Harvard Law School in MA 1995.

He is an attorney at law admitted in New York, USA.

Yuko Noguchi

Director, Head of Legal - Google Japan

Yuko Noguchi is a leading expert in information / technology law and intellectual property law. As a Director and Head of Legal at Google Japan, she oversees all legal matters for the company, including product-related consultation, dispute resolution, and public policy engagement, handling most cutting- edge legal matters in the information technology law.

Prior to joining Google, Yuko was a Partner at Mori Hamada & Matsumoto, specializing in intellectual property law. She has worked on a wide range of IP matters, including international disputes, M&A transactions, and advising prominent US internet companies on Japanese law.

Yuko holds a JSD from Stanford Law School and is qualified as a lawyer in Japan. She is a sought-after speaker and commentator on legal and technology issues and has been recognized as a top attorney by Chambers Global, Chambers Asia, and Best Lawyers.

and many more..

FINALISTS

The wait is over, and the anticipation has reached its peak! We are thrilled to announce the highly anticipated list of finalists for the ALB Japan Law Awards 2024. Congratulations to all the finalists and we look forward to celebrating their successes on June 12th at the Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo. *

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

ELIGIBILITY

How do I know if I am eligible to make a submission?

We highly encourage all firms, individuals and in-house teams to submit, as we have numerous award categories to choose from. We welcome both past participants and newcomers to join the submission for the awards.

Is self-nomination permitted?

Yes, we accept self-nominated submissions. We also accept third-party submissions, should you wish to nominate an external party or vice versa.

Is there a fee required to make a submission in the law awards?

Each submission for the law awards must be accompanied by a non-refundable application fee of USD $30 which will go towards helping ALB process your submission for the purpose of judging. The application fee must be received by the submission deadline in order for the submission to be considered for the award. The payment of the application fee does not guarantee that the submission will be shortlisted for an award. Note this is only applicable for law firms.

TIMELINE OF EVENTS

When will the finalists and winners be announced?

The shortlist of finalists will be released around 4-8 weeks prior to the awards ceremony. The winners will be exclusively announced at the awards ceremony on June 2024.

NOMINATION PROCESS AND ASSESSMENT

How are the finalists chosen?

Asian Legal Business will compile all of the submission entries, and the ALB editorial and research teams will extensively review each submission to ensure the criteria are met in order to advance to the shortlist of finalists. We stress that this process is fair, impartial and not subject to external influences.

How are the winners chosen?

Once the shortlist of finalists have been announced, an independent judging panel will review and select their top five choices for the award categories they are assigned to. The scores for each award category will be tabulated, and the individual/firm/team with the highest score will be announced as the winner.

What are the award categories that I can take part in?

Any law firms, in-house teams or individuals may take part in multiple award categories if appropriate. ALB reserve the right to move entries from one category to another if such a change is considered appropriate. ALB’s decisions are final, and no correspondence will be entered into.

Who will be on the judging panel for ALB Law Awards?

There will be an independent judging panel of at least 25 senior and expert legal industry leaders to review the submission materials. The judging panel will be selected on the basis of their expertise and knowledge and will be comprised from various sectors to correspond to the diverse list of award categories. A partial list of judges’ names will be released prior to the awarding ceremony, and the remaining judges will be revealed on the evening of the awards.

What will my contact information/my client’s information be used for?

All contact information provided will not be disclosed to external parties; and will only be seen by our ALB research team and the judges panel. We keep the information on record internally, in case we need to contact you or your client regarding any questions or discrepancies in the submission form.

Where will my name/firm name/team name be published if we are a finalist or winner?

As a finalist and/or winner, your firm/team/individual name will be published in ALB awards materials and print magazine. For more information, please contact us.

Is my submission confidential?

The submission information will be provided to the independent judging panel, for the judging purpose only, whose names will be published. The material submitted will only be disclosed to the above; if there is any information that is strictly confidential, please mark clearly on the nomination form. Though we do our best to maintain the security of the information you provide, any information you transmit to us is done at your own risk and Thomson Reuters is not responsible for any unauthorized transmission of information.

SPONSORSHIP, PARTICIPATION AND OTHER

I would like to sponsor the ALB Law Awards.

Please contact Amantha.Chia@thomsonreuters.com or (+65) 6973 8258 for further details regarding sponsorship.

I am interested in being an official partner of the ALB Law Awards, as a media/legal association.

Please contact tracy.li@thomsonreuters.com.

My practice area or specialty is not listed, but I would like to participate in the Awards.

Please get in touch with our ALB Law Awards research team at Albawards@thomsonreuters.com.

Can I participate in Awards across the region?

Yes, you can participate in more than one market. Please note there may be specific criteria for each market.

What happens if the winner of a category is not able to attend the ceremony?

The award will be given to the highest-scoring firm, department or individual in attendance at the ceremony.

Disclaimer

Note: We encourage finalists to attend the awards ceremony. The results of the Awards will be announced on the night of the ceremony, and the trophy will be given to the highest-scoring firm, department or individual in attendance at the ceremony. We congratulate all finalists and encourage you to attend the ceremony to celebrate your achievements together.

Who should attend the Awards Ceremony? Can I attend?

We welcome all finalists and non-finalists to join the Awards Ceremony; please contact Amantha.Chia@thomsonreuters.com or (+65) 6973 8258.

I would like to order a winner’s trophy and/or certificate (for finalists and winners).

Please contact Amantha.Chia@thomsonreuters.com or (+65) 6973 8258.

How can I receive communications related to the ALB Law Awards?

Please email tracy.li@thomsonreuters.com to subscribe to the ALB mailing list.

Asian Legal Business – Who are We?

Asian Legal Business (ALB) is owned by Thomson Reuters, the world’s leading source of intelligent information for business and professionals. With its portfolio of leading titles, law awards, in-house legal summits and online services, ALB provides authoritative and unbiased insights and unmatched networking and business development opportunities to legal professionals throughout the Asia-Pacific.

ALB combines news and analysis from its team of professional legal journalists and the expert opinions of senior industry professionals with Reuters news and insights that power businesses across the globe.

Please visit legalbusinessonline.com for further information.

Asian Legal Business – Law Awards

The ALB Law Awards are the pre-eminent legal awards in Asia-Pacific, held annually in Hong Kong, China, Singapore, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, India and UAE. The Awards are comprised of months of intensive research and culminate in a black-tie Awarding Ceremony in each of the markets. We cordially invite you to take part in these prestigious awards and celebrate.
